sub_topic: Prove that the Cartesian product of two sets is not commutative with respect to intersection.
message_1: Let A = {1, 2, 3} and B = {2, 3, 4}. Find (A x B) ∩ (B x A) , where "x" represents the Cartesian product of two sets. Show that this proves the Cartesian product of two sets is not commutative with respect to intersection.
